solution_line_template: If he gathers for {hours_gathering} hours, the number of minutes gathering is {hours_gathering} * {minutes_per_hour} minutes per hour = <<{hours_gathering}*{minutes_per_hour}={minutes_gathering}>>{minutes_gathering} minutes of gathering flowers

Gathering for {minutes_gathering} minutes / {minutes_per_flower} minutes per flower = <<{minutes_gathering}/{minutes_per_flower}={flowers_gathered_initial}>>{flowers_gathered_initial} flowers gathered

If he gathers {flowers_gathered_initial} flowers initially but lost {flowers_lost}, he has {flowers_gathered_initial}-{flowers_lost} = <<{flowers_gathered_initial}-{flowers_lost}={flowers_kept}>>{flowers_kept} flowers gathered and kept

Since he has {total_classmates} classmates total and has {flowers_kept} flowers, he needs to gather {total_classmates}-{flowers_kept}=<<{total_classmates}-{flowers_kept}={flowers_needed_additional}>>{flowers_needed_additional} more flowers

Assuming it takes {minutes_per_flower} minutes per flower, it will take him {minutes_per_flower} * {flowers_needed_additional} = <<{minutes_per_flower}*{flowers_needed_additional}={minutes_needed_additional}>>{minutes_needed_additional} minutes to gather the remaining {flowers_needed_additional} flowers needed
